\title[panel]{Panel Data}
\author[]{Zhentao Shi}
\date{The Chinese University of Hong Kong}

\begin{document}

\frame{\titlepage}

% Uncomment if you want a table of contents slide
% \begin{frame}
%     \tableofcontents
% \end{frame}


\section{Panel Data}
\frame{\sectionpage}

\begin{frame}{Panel Data Structure}
    \begin{itemize}
        \item The same individuals over time $t=1,\ldots,T$  
        \item The potential endogeneity of regressors  
        \item i.i.d. across $i=1,\ldots,n$  
        \item dependence allowed within a group over $t=1,\ldots,T$ for the same $i$.  
            \begin{equation}
                y_{it}=\beta_{1}+x_{it}\beta_{2}+u_{it},\ i=1,\ldots,n; t=1,\ldots,T \label{eq:basic_eq}
            \end{equation}  
            $u_{it}=\alpha_{i}+\epsilon_{it}$ : \emph{composite error}.
    \end{itemize}
\end{frame}

\subsection{Fixed Effect}
\frame{\subsectionpage}

\begin{frame}{Fixed Effect Model}
    \begin{itemize}
        \item If $\mathrm{cov}(\alpha_{i},x_{it})=0$, OLS is consistent. Otherwise, consistency breaks down  
        \item Arbitrary correlation between $\alpha_{i}$ and $x_{it}$  
        \item Eliminate $\alpha_{i}$
            \begin{equation}
            \overline{y}_{i}=\beta_{1}+\overline{x}_{i}\beta_{2}+\bar{u}_{it}=\beta_{1}+\overline{x}_{i}\beta_{2}+\alpha_{i}+\bar{\epsilon}_{it}\label{eq:group_mean}
            \end{equation}  
            where $\overline{y}_{i}=\frac{1}{T}\sum_{t=1}^{T}y_{it}$ \\  
            Subtracting (\ref{eq:group_mean}) from (\ref{eq:basic_eq})  
            \begin{equation}
            \tilde{y}_{it}=\tilde{x}_{it}\beta_{2}+\tilde{\epsilon}_{it}\label{eq:FE_demean}
            \end{equation}  
            where $\tilde{y}_{it}=y_{it}-\overline{y}_{i}$
    \end{itemize}
\end{frame}

\begin{frame}{Within Estimator}
    \begin{itemize}
        \item Within estimator:
        \[
            \widehat{\beta}_{2}^{FE}=\left(\tilde{X}'\tilde{X}\right)^{-1}\tilde{X}'\tilde{y}  
        \]
        \item Consistency is achieved if strict exogeneity holds.
    \end{itemize} 
    \begin{assumption*}[FE.1]
        $E\left[\epsilon_{it}|\alpha_{i},\mathbf{x}_{i}\right]=0$ where $\mathbf{x}_{i}=\left(x_{i1},\ldots,x_{iT}\right)$. 
    \end{assumption*} 
    \begin{assumption*}[FE.2]
     $\mathrm{var}\left(\epsilon_{i}|\alpha_{i},\mathbf{x}_{i}\right)=\sigma_{\epsilon}^{2}I_{T}$. 
    \end{assumption*}
\end{frame}

\begin{frame}{Variance Estimation for FE}
    \begin{itemize}
        \item Under homoskedasticity:
        \[
            \widehat{\sigma}_{\epsilon}^{2}=\frac{1}{n\left(T-1\right)}\sum_{i=1}^{n}\sum_{t=1}^{T}\widehat{\tilde{\epsilon}}_{it}^{2}.
        \]
        where $\widehat{\tilde{\epsilon}}=\tilde{y}_{it}-\tilde{x}_{it}\widehat{\beta}_{2}^{FE}$  
    \end{itemize}
    \begin{theorem}[FE Asymptotic Normality]
        If FE.1 and FE.2 hold, then
        \[
            \left(\widehat{\sigma}_{\epsilon}^{2}\left(\tilde{X}'\tilde{X}\right)^{-1}\right)^{-1/2}\left(\widehat{\beta}_{2}^{FE}-\beta_{2}^{0}\right)\Rightarrow N\left(0,I_{K}\right).
        \]
    \end{theorem}
\end{frame}

\subsection{Random Effect}
\frame{\subsectionpage}

\begin{frame}{Random Effect}
    \begin{itemize}
        \item $\mathrm{cov}(\alpha_{i},x_{it})=0$.  
    \end{itemize}
    \begin{assumption*}[RE.1]
        $E\left[\epsilon_{it}|\alpha_{i},\mathbf{x}_{i}\right]=0$ and $E\left[\alpha_{i}|\mathbf{x}_{i}\right]=0$.  
    \end{assumption*}
    \[S=\mathrm{var}\left(u_{i}|\mathbf{x}_{i}\right)=\sigma_{\alpha}^{2}\mathbf{1}_{T}\mathbf{1}_{T}'+\sigma_{\epsilon}^{2}I_{T},\ \mbox{for all }i=1,\ldots,n.  
    \]
    \begin{itemize}
        \item rewrite (\ref{eq:basic_eq}) 
            \[
            y_{it}=w_{it}\boldsymbol{\beta}+u_{it},
            \]
            where $\boldsymbol{\beta}=\left(\beta_{1},\beta_{2}'\right)'$ and
            $w_{it}=\left(1,x_{it}\right)$ are $K+1$ vectors  
        \item the GLS estimator is:
            \[
            \widehat{\boldsymbol{\beta}}^{RE}=\left(\sum_{i=1}^{n}\mathbf{w}_{i}'S^{-1}\mathbf{w}_{i}\right)^{-1}\sum_{i=1}^{n}\mathbf{w}_{i}'S^{-1}\mathbf{y}_{i}=\left(W'\mathbf{S}^{-1}W\right)^{-1}W'\mathbf{S}^{-1}y
            \]
            where $\mathbf{S}=I_{T}\otimes S$
    \end{itemize} 
\end{frame}

\begin{frame}{Random Effect}
    \begin{assumption*}[RE.2]
        $\mathrm{var}\left(\epsilon_{i}|\mathbf{x}_{i},\alpha_{i}\right)=\sigma_{\epsilon}^{2}I_{T}$
    and $\mathrm{var}\left(\alpha_{i}|\mathbf{x}_{i}\right)=\sigma_{\alpha}^{2}.$
    \end{assumption*}  
    \begin{itemize}
        \item $\widehat{u}_{it}=y_{it}-x_{it}\widehat{\boldsymbol{\beta}}^{RE}$  
        \item \begin{eqnarray*}
            \widehat{\sigma}_{u}^{2} &=& \frac{1}{nT}\sum_{i=1}^{n}\sum_{t=1}^{T}\widehat{u}_{it}^{2},   \\
            \widehat{\sigma}_{\epsilon}^{2} &=& \frac{1}{n}\sum_{i=1}^{n}\frac{1}{T(T-1)}\sum_{t=1}^{T}\sum_{r=1}^{T}\sum_{r\neq t}\widehat{u}_{it}\widehat{u}_{ir}.
        \end{eqnarray*}
    \end{itemize}
\end{frame}


\begin{frame}{Hausman Test}

    \begin{itemize}
        \item Tests for correlation between $\alpha_{i}$ and $x_{it}$.  
        \item Null hypothesis: $\mathrm{cov}(\alpha_{i},x_{it})=0$.  
        \item Test statistic:
        \begin{align*}
            &\left(\widehat{\beta}_{2}^{FE}-\widehat{\beta}_{2}^{RE}\right)^{'}\left(\widehat{Avar}\left(\widehat{\beta}_{2}^{FE}\right)-\widehat{Avar}\left(\widehat{\beta}_{2}^{RE}\right)\right)^{-1}\left(\widehat{\beta}_{2}^{FE}-\widehat{\beta}_{2}^{RE}\right)\\
            &\Rightarrow \chi^{2}(K)
        \end{align*}
    \end{itemize}
\end{frame}

\end{document}
